text: can use functions provided visualize data  search specific fields like author information, publication details, call numbers using search_finna, can use Finna’s field-specific search filters. title: Fennica in Finna
text: want search publication information publication date publisher, can use type = "Title" type = "AllFields" apply filters: specific years, can use search_daterange_mv filter: search publisher, can add filter publisher name:
code: search_finna(query = "Sibelius", filters = c('search_daterange_mv:"[2000 TO 2020]"')) search_finna(query = "Sibelius", filters = c('publisher:"Ondine"'))

title: Fennica in Finna
text: Call numbers used classify items libraries. search call number, can add filter callnumber-search callnumber: return results call number 78.54 (typically used orchestral music).
code: search_finna(query = "Sibelius", filters = c('callnumber-search:"78.54"'))

title: Fennica in Finna
text: can combine search types filters make complex queries. instance, search works Jean Sibelius published 2000 2020 call number 78.54:
code: search_finna(   query = "Sibelius",   filters = c('author:"Jean Sibelius"', 'search_daterange_mv:"[2000 TO 2020]"', 'callnumber-search:"78.54"') )

title: Fennica in Finna
code: # Author search example search_finna(query = "Jean Sibelius", type = "Author")  # Search for works by author with publication date range search_finna(query = "Jean Sibelius", filters = c('search_daterange_mv:"[2000 TO 2020]"'))  # Search for works by call number search_finna(query = "Sibelius", filters = c('callnumber-search:"78.54"'))  # Combine author, publication date, and call number filters search_finna(   query = "Sibelius",   filters = c('author:"Jean Sibelius"', 'search_daterange_mv:"[2000 TO 2020]"', 'callnumber-search:"78.54"') )

title: Fennica in Finna
text: Filters: filters need match exact field names used Finna’s API. can find field names API documentation looking response API. Call Number Search: Ensure call numbers correctly formatted according library’s classification system (e.g., YKL Finland). way, can extract specific metadata like authors, publication years, call numbers using search_finna function.

title: Refine, integrate and analyse Finna metadata
text: purpose refine_metadata() function : Ensure completeness filling missing values placeholder text. Standardize key metadata fields easier analysis. Select relevant fields, simplifying dataset. refinement process makes metadata consistent user-friendly, reducing potential issues subsequent analysis reporting.
code: library(finna) sibelius_data <- search_finna("sibelius") refined_data <- refine_metadata(sibelius_data) print(refined_data) ## # A tibble: 100 × 8 ##    Title                   Author Year  Language Formats Subjects Library Series ##    <chr>                   <chr>  <chr> <chr>    <chr>   <chr>    <chr>   <chr>  ##  1 Sibelius favourites : … Sibel… 2001  Unknown… Äänite… orkeste… Lapin … Unkno… ##  2 Sibelius                Tappe… 1967  Unknown… Taidet… Unknown… Jyväsk… Unkno… ##  3 Sibelius                Favén… Unkn… Unknown… Taidet… kaljuus… Lahden… Unkno… ##  4 Sibelius                Tawas… 2003  fin      Kirja,… Sibeliu… Anders… Unkno… ##  5 Sibelius                Ringb… 1948  fin      Kirja,… Sibeliu… Eepos-… Unkno… ##  6 SIBELIUS                TÖRNE… 1945  fin      Kirja,… SIBELIU… Helle-… Unkno… ##  7 Sibelius                Lampi… 1995  fin      Kirja,… Sibeliu… Kansal… Unkno… ##  8 Sibelius                Lampi… 2005  fin      Kirja,… Sibeliu… Kansal… Unkno… ##  9 Sibelius                Lampi… 1984  fin      Kirja,… Sibeliu… Kansal… Unkno… ## 10 Sibelius                Tawas… 1997  fin      Kirja,… Sibeliu… Kansal… Unkno… ## # ℹ 90 more rows

title: Refine, integrate and analyse Finna metadata
text: integrate two datasets using full_join() dplyr, can write code directly like :
code: library(dplyr)  # Example Finna metadata (metadata1) finna_data <- search_finna("sibelius",limit = 4)  # Example other dataset to merge with (metadata2) other_data <- tibble::tibble(   Title = c("Sibelius Symphony No. 5", "Finlandia", "Valse Triste"),   Rating = c(5, 4, 3) )  # Integrate the two datasets using full_join by the "Title" column integrated_data <- full_join(finna_data, other_data, by = "Title")  # Print the integrated dataset print(integrated_data) ## # A tibble: 7 × 11 ##   id    Title Author Year  Language Formats Subjects Library Series last_indexed ##   <chr> <chr> <chr>  <chr> <chr>    <chr>   <chr>    <chr>   <chr>  <chr>        ## 1 lapi… Sibe… Sibel… 2001  NA       Äänite… orkeste… Lapin … NA     NA           ## 2 jtm.… Sibe… Tappe… 1967  NA       Taidet… NA       Jyväsk… NA     NA           ## 3 lahd… Sibe… Favén… NA    NA       Taidet… kaljuus… Lahden… NA     NA           ## 4 ande… Sibe… Tawas… 2003  fin      Kirja,… Sibeliu… Anders… NA     NA           ## 5 NA    Sibe… NA     NA    NA       NA      NA       NA      NA     NA           ## 6 NA    Finl… NA     NA    NA       NA      NA       NA      NA     NA           ## 7 NA    Vals… NA     NA    NA       NA      NA       NA      NA     NA           ## # ℹ 1 more variable: Rating <dbl>

title: Viola in Finna

previous_headings: Viola Collection in Finna > Example Usage
title: Viola in Finna
text: following example fetches data Viola collection year ranges: 0–1699, 1700–1799, 1800–1899.
code: library(finna)  # Fetch records results <- fetch_viola_records(   base_query = "*",   base_filters = c('collection:"VIO"'), # Filters for the Viola collection   year_ranges = list(c(1700,1705)),           # Year ranges to query   include_na = TRUE,                   # Include records with missing dates   limit_per_query = 100000,              # Maximum records per query   total_limit = Inf,                 # Overall record limit   delay_after_query = 3                # Delay between API calls   )  # View the number of records fetched print(nrow(results)) ## [1] 2687 head(results) ## # A tibble: 6 × 10 ##   id    Title Author Year  Language Formats Subjects Library Series last_indexed ##   <chr> <chr> <chr>  <chr> <chr>    <chr>   <chr>    <chr>   <chr>  <chr>        ## 1 fikk… [Kor… NA     1702  fin      Nuotti  arkisto… Kansal… NA     NA           ## 2 fikk… [Yxi… NA     1702  fin      Nuotti  arkisto… Kansal… NA     NA           ## 3 fikk… [Gra… NA     NA    fin      Nuotti  arkisto… Kansal… NA     NA           ## 4 jykd… Soti… NA     NA    fin      Äänite… NA       Jyväsk… NA     NA           ## 5 fikk… Demo  NA     NA    zxx      Äänite… NA       Kansal… NA     NA           ## 6 fikk… Boog… NA     NA    zxx      Äänite… NA       Kansal… NA     NA

what: Harvest Metadata from an OAI-PMH Server — harvest_oai_pmh
title: Harvest Metadata from an OAI-PMH Server — harvest_oai_pmh
text: function harvests metadata records OAI-PMH-compliant server batches, using custom User-Agent string identify service returns tibble format.

title: Harvest Metadata from an OAI-PMH Server — harvest_oai_pmh
code: harvest_oai_pmh(   base_url,   metadata_prefix,   set = NULL,   verbose = TRUE,   user_agent = "FinnaHarvester/1.0",   output_file = NULL,   record_limit = NULL )

title: Harvest Metadata from an OAI-PMH Server — harvest_oai_pmh
text: base_url string. base URL OAI-PMH server. metadata_prefix string. metadata format request (e.g., "oai_dc", "marc21"). set string. Optional. set specifier limit harvested records (e.g., "non_dedup"). verbose logical. Whether display progress messages. Default TRUE. user_agent string. custom User-Agent string identify service. Default "FinnaHarvester/1.0". output_file output file saved csv file. record_limit limits number records user wants fetch

title: Harvest Metadata from an OAI-PMH Server — harvest_oai_pmh
text: tibble harvested records containing selected metadata fields.

title: Harvest Metadata from an OAI-PMH Server — harvest_oai_pmh
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{  # Example for oai_dc (Dublin Core) records_oai_dc <- harvest_oai_pmh( base_url = "https://api.finna.fi/OAI/Server", metadata_prefix = "oai_dc", user_agent = "MyCustomHarvester/1.0" ) # Example for marc21 (MARC 21) records_marc21 <- harvest_oai_pmh( base_url = "https://api.finna.fi/OAI/Server", metadata_prefix = "marc21", user_agent = "MyCustomHarvester/1.0" )  # Example for oai_vufind_json (VuFind JSON) records_oai_vufind_json <- harvest_oai_pmh( base_url = "https://api.finna.fi/OAI/Server", metadata_prefix = "oai_vufind_json", user_agent = "MyCustomHarvester/1.0" )  # Example for oai_ead (Encoded Archival Description) records_oai_ead <- harvest_oai_pmh( base_url = "https://api.finna.fi/OAI/Server", metadata_prefix = "oai_ead", user_agent = "MyCustomHarvester/1.0" ) # Example for oai_ead3 (Encoded Archival Description version 3) records_oai_ead3 <- harvest_oai_pmh( base_url = "https://api.finna.fi/OAI/Server", metadata_prefix = "oai_ead3", user_agent = "MyCustomHarvester/1.0" )  # Example for oai_forward (Forward metadata format) records_oai_forward <- harvest_oai_pmh( base_url = "https://api.finna.fi/OAI/Server", metadata_prefix = "oai_forward", user_agent = "MyCustomHarvester/1.0" )  # Example for oai_lido (Lightweight Information Describing Objects) records_oai_lido <- harvest_oai_pmh( base_url = "https://api.finna.fi/OAI/Server", metadata_prefix = "oai_lido", user_agent = "MyCustomHarvester/1.0" )  # Example for oai_qdc (Qualified Dublin Core) records_oai_qdc <- harvest_oai_pmh( base_url = "https://api.finna.fi/OAI/Server", metadata_prefix = "oai_qdc", user_agent = "MyCustomHarvester/1.0" ) } # }

what: Finna Index Search with Total Limit Option — search_finna
title: Finna Index Search with Total Limit Option — search_finna
text: function retrieves records Finna index option limit total number records returned. function paginates results, fetching records specified total limit reached.

title: Finna Index Search with Total Limit Option — search_finna
code: search_finna(   query = NULL,   type = "AllFields",   fields = NULL,   filters = NULL,   facets = NULL,   facetFilters = NULL,   sort = "relevance,id asc",   limit = 100,   lng = "fi",   prettyPrint = FALSE )

title: Finna Index Search with Total Limit Option — search_finna
text: query description type string specifying type search. Options include "AllFields", "Title", "Author", "Subject". Defaults "AllFields". fields vector fields returned search results. Defaults NULL, returns standard set fields. filters vector filter queries refine search. Defaults NULL. facets vector specifying facets return results. Defaults NULL. facetFilters vector regular expressions filter facets. Defaults NULL. sort string defining sort order results. Options include: "relevance,id asc" (default) "main_date_str desc" (Year, newest first) "main_date_str asc" (Year, oldest first) "last_indexed desc" (Last modified) "first_indexed desc" (Last added) "callnumber,id asc" (Classmark) "author,id asc" (Author) "title,id asc" (Title) limit integer specifying total number records return across multiple pages. lng string language returned translated strings. Options "fi", "en-gb", "sv", "se". Defaults "fi". prettyPrint logical value indicating whether pretty-print JSON response. Useful debugging. Defaults FALSE.

title: Finna Index Search with Total Limit Option — search_finna
text: tibble containing search results relevant fields extracted provenance information.
